NegativeReview: THE NOISE I really wanted to give the hotel a great score as so much is good about it but that s difficult to do when out of a 4 night stay you don t get a single good night s sleep The road noise is fine and the beds comfortable but the walls are paper thin so you can hear EVERYTHING your fellow guests are doing saying Each night we were woken up either by doors banging tv s on coughing and spluttering talking or even other guests banging walls at their noisy neighbours You might think its not the hotel s fault if our neighbours were noisy but they weren t really You should be able to have your tv on or even cough without the worry of disturbing the guests next door The double room cost under 45 per night which is brilliant for the location and everything else but take your ear plugs and probably avoid if you re a light sleeper

PositiveReview: A rarity amongst hotels it looked as good in real life as it does in its pictures Very comfortable and full of thoughtful touches For example instead of the usual mini bottle of shampoo in the shower there was a large shampoo a large conditioner and a large hair repairer There were free tea and coffee with mini cakes and biscuits 24 hours a day There was even a large glass container of iced mint leaves for those who like mint tea Oh and jars of sweets too The bedrooms are all individually designed and lack nothing The staff were constantly attentive and cheerful and nothing was too much trouble The breakfast choice was very extensive the best we have come across in our four years of travelling Europe and the scrambled eggs were constantly replenished so that they were always fresh and never past their best as so often happens if you get to breakfast late Breakfast was available until 11am another plus point Downsides 55 per 24 hour for parking but still cheaper than street parking The only thing that could improve the hotel would be a large open fire blazing away
